Context: The George Brown College is committed to complying with Canada's Anti-Spam Legislation (CASL) regarding electronic communications with outside parties. This legislation took effect on July 1st, 2014. Outside parties can manage their communication preferences by unsubscribing through the College's Preference Centre or contacting casl@georgebrown.ca. The College complies with rules and regulations enforced by the Canadian Radio-television and Telecommunications Commission (CRTC), the Competition Bureau, and the Privacy Commissioner of Canada. Electronic communications from the College are protected by business procedures and policies to ensure compliance with CASL. All commercial electronic messages sent by the College to outside parties are subject to CASL regulations.
file_path: scraped_pages/otherpages/George Brown College – Anti–Spam Commitment | George Brown College.txt

Context:
The College has adopted an Anti-Spam Commitment to comply with Canada's Anti-Spam Legislation (CASL). They have implemented a Preference Center for managing consent requirements for Commercial Electronic Messages (CEMs). Express consent is required from recipients, which can be obtained through the Preference Center or by updating communication preferences.

Recipients can modify how the College interacts with them without unsubscribing completely. All CEMs must include certain prescribed content such as identification of the College as the sender, contact information, and a working unsubscribe mechanism. The College has modified its email footers to meet these requirements.
file_path: scraped_pages/otherpages/George Brown College – Anti–Spam Commitment | George Brown College.txt

Context:
The College has modified its email footers to comply with Canada's Anti-Spam Legislation (CASL). CASL requires each Commercial Electronic Message (CEM) to have a functional unsubscribe mechanism, which must be processed within 10 business days. The College has incorporated unsubscribe mechanisms into all CEMs and has set up processes to ensure that all unsubscribe requests are complied with.

The types of CEMs the College may send include messages about new business opportunities or ventures, if consent has been implied or expressly given, or if an exemption applies. Exempt messages include those from an existing employee via social media, if the recipient is connected to the employee on the social network or has indicated openness to receiving such messages, and if the message is in connection with their business role and function. Recipients may also receive CEMs if they have conspicuously published their electronic address and have not indicated that they did not wish to receive CEMs.

Recipients who believe they have received a CEM in error can contact the College at casl@georgebrown.ca to have their address removed from the list within 10 business days if required by CASL. The College takes privacy and compliance with laws seriously, and recipients may unsubscribe at any time from receiving CEMs by clicking on the unsubscribe link in the received message or managing their preferences in the Preference Centre.

Entities mentioned:
- Canada's Anti-Spam Legislation (CASL)
- Commercial Electronic Message (CEM)
- College
- casl@georgebrown.ca
- Preference Centre
file_path: scraped_pages/otherpages/George Brown College – Anti–Spam Commitment | George Brown College.txt

Context:
The George Brown College has an Anti-Spam Commitment that outlines their policies regarding email communications with subscribers. The commitment was last updated on June 16, 2017. Subscribers can unsubscribe from commercial emails by adjusting their interests or contacting casl@georgebrown.ca. The College may review and update the Anti-Spam Commitment as needed.

Contact information:
- Email: casl@georgebrown.ca
- Phone: 416-415-2000, TTY: 1-877-515-5559
- Email inquiry: ask.george@georgebrown.ca

Website visitors can sign up for updates about application deadlines, college news, upcoming events, tours and more by visiting "Sign Up Now." The College's social media hub is also available for interaction.

Additionally, the information provided on their website is subject to change without notice and should not be considered a representation or warranty. Students are responsible for verifying George Brown College fee requirements.
